text: Seven Brief Lessons on Physics () is a short book by the Italian physicist Carlo Rovelli. Originally published in Italian in 2014, the book has been translated into 41 languages. More than a million copies have been sold, of which more than 400,000 in Italy. ==Overview== The book condenses the revelations of post-Newtonian physics – from Einstein's theory of relativity to quantum mechanics – into seven brief, accessible lessons: # The Most Beautiful of Theories # The Quanta # The Architecture of the Cosmos # Particles # Grains of Space # Probability, Time and the Heat of Black Holes # Ourselves ==References== Category:2014 non-fiction books Category:Penguin Books books Category:Italian non-fiction books Category:Popular physics books
title: Seven Brief Lessons on Physics
